summary:
I graduated from the University of South Florida in 2011 with a Bachelor of Arts and Sciences in Women and Gender Studies. I maintained a 4.0 GPA within my collegiate focus and graduated with honors. In 2012, I started attending the proper courses required by the IND for Dutch immigration through the Ttif.Company. In early 2014, I received my diploma for the Staats Examen NT2 I. My past education experiences have provided me with a lot of practice in research, ranging from researching topics on human/gender/women's rights, environmental policies, the relations of food to our cultural and historical backgrounds, and even how to properly use verbs and form sentences in the Dutch language. Along with research, my writing skills have also been fine tuned due to the copious amounts of papers, projects, and presentations I was assigned, as well as the essays I practiced writing weekly in order to pass the Staats Examen.

I also have the ability to balance busy work schedules with life. I attended University full time, worked full time, became a volunteer research assistant, and maintained a social life. I volunteered as a research assistant at Mary Help of Christians Foundation Inc, beginning in early 2011. Through this position, I researched grants that were available and that the foundation could apply for. I also edited grant proposals before they were submitted. In addition, I worked in a high volume casino and was able to acquire great teamwork skills, sharpen my customer service skills, further improve my communication skills with guests, colleagues, and management, and be responsible for large volumes of money.

I am confident that I would be an asset to a company because I have the ability to learn new skills, succeed at anything I put my mind to, work well within group and personal settings, remain both flexible and focused, and multi-task while still paying attention to detail. I do have a valid work permit in the Netherlands.

profile_positions.description:
Involved with new product launches in the EU market

Direct contact with internal and external customers via phone and email.

Create agreements for evaluations, loans, rentals and purchases of electrosurgical equipment

Understand and delegate customer requests to appropriate departments

Investigate and solve customer disputes either directly or by communicating and working with other departments internally

Create and maintain training manuals for new colleagues

Creating and mailing letters to customers for advisory notices on specific products

Assist other departments within Customer Service with daily tasks
profile_positions.title: Customer Relations Representative

profile_positions.description:
Being the first point of contact for the company and providing a positive experience for customers. 

Assist customers with product information, processing payment, and changing shipping options on placed orders.

Multi-task and assist multiple customers at one time while searching for product or order information. 

Learn and maintain product knowledge of current, new and upcoming products.

Work with logistic companies to build a working relationship and assist with shipping options for customers.

Stand as first line of defense to combat fraud and work with other teams to protect sensitive information.

Trained new colleagues on live chat and email. Shared resource and training material to colleagues in order to improve service team-wide.
profile_positions.title: Customer Support Specialist - Nike Account

company.name: Seminole Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Tampa

profile_positions.company: Seminole Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Tampa
profile_positions.description:
Built and maintained strong interpersonal relationships with colleagues in order to build a stronger team and improve communications. 

Built relationships with guests and used customer service skill sets to provide positive dining experiences for guests.  

Learned knowledge of restaurant operations including how both the front of house and back of house operate. 

Worked with seating software systems to accommodate guests with seating.

Trained new hostesses by teaching them the inner operations of the restaurant, items offered on the menu, and how to use the seating software on the computer. 

Maintained responsibility for large quantities of money, issued by the casino. 

Maintained strong knowledge of the point of sale system and how to troubleshoot it. 

Completed payment transactions within restaurants and clubs operated by the casino. 

Engaged in special events hosted by the casino and provided great social and customer service skills to the VIP guests in attendance

Worked with gaming software systems to create new customer accounts and approve credit checks for casino loans. 

Accessed and protected sensitive customer information.

Cataloged and organized tactical gear for United States military.

Located items needed for shipping, boxed items, and completed shipping information and customs forms in order for tactical gear to reach intended destinations.

Built a working relationship with stock room manager so that I was notified of new products being shipped to us. 

Updated floor plans as new products arrived and displayed them so that they could be prominently seen.  

Coached colleagues on the proper way to display the shoes on the showroom floor and how to shelf stock in the back stockroom.

Created registries for multiple occasions. 

Had knowledge of the computer system and program used.

Processed returns and completed sales.

Took inventory of items and built an extensive knowledge of products that were most commonly bought.

Use of exemplary customer service skills when communicating with customers.

Participated in and completed group projects around the store.

profile_positions.description:

Organized stock room and inventory available for purchase.

Helped keep store clean with weekly deep cleaning and daily cleaning of the shelves the inventory was on.

Completed opening and closing day paperwork consisting of projected sales and actual sales.
